title: Android app crashes if moved to foreground after running on background for some time (several hours or a night)

labels.name: core-ui-grooming
labels.description: To be reviewed on the next core ui grooming to add the issue to team board and set priority

body:
### Description

[comment]: # (Feature or Bug? i.e Type: Bug)
*Type*: Bug

[comment]: # (Describe the feature you would like, or briefly summarise the bug and what you did, what you expected to happen, and what actually happens. Sections below)
*Summary*: App crashed after it's moved from background to foreground. Usually, it happens if app was on background for several hours or left for a night. Full logcat is attached at the end of report.

#### Expected behavior

[comment]: # (Describe what you expected to happen.)
user can proceed working with app after it's moved to foreground
#### Actual behavior
app crashed


### Reproduction

[comment]: # (Describe how we can replicate the bug step by step.)

- Open Status
- open public chat where no new messages will be recieved
- move app to background
- leave phone for a night 
- turn on phone and move app to foreground


### Additional Information

[comment]: # (Please do your best to fill this out.)
- Status version: nightly from July 11
- Operating System: Android 9, real Pixel XL

#### Logs

[crashed.log](https://github.com/status-im/status-react/files/3385956/crashed.log)

Confirmed the crash with Android 8.1 and Android 9 with **Release candidate 0.14** (16th Jenkins build)
On both devices, Status left running on background overnight.

I've seen it when Status was on background for ~1h, sometimes (so no need to wait so long to reproduce the issue)
still can repro on nightly August 29 build (Android 9, Pixel XL), so adding to v1 release scope
@Serhy does it still reproduce? Error description in the image above suggests that it could be resolved in https://github.com/status-im/status-react/pull/8868

@siphiuel  No, can't reproduce. 
Now, with the latest nightly, there is no such crash. App simply re-opens if it was closed (lost connection or something like that if I recall correctly about the reason of when that crash happened in the past). 
No crash errors now.
Closing the issue.
